moves.2. Nf3: Apparently called the King's Knight opening, but it's still fairly standard.
moves.2... d6: My standard defense in this situation.
moves.3. Bb5+: I've never really been a fan of this move.  It seems like putting black just for the sake of saying "check."  While it may weaken the queen side defenses, I like Bc4 instead.
moves.3... Bd7: Protect the King and threaten the bishop.
moves.4. Bc4: Now he's where he should be.
moves.4... Nf6: In hindsight, Be6 was probably a better move.  If he accepts, it's a simple BxB trade, and if he plays 4...Bd5+, I can follow it with 5.c6 and force his bishop back to d3 or farther.  But I guess this was a fine move.
moves.5. Ng5: When I saw this move, I was kind of confused.  I've seen (and tried) the queen side fork many times, but this was the first time I've seen it tried king side.
moves.5... h6: Going to attack the knight.  I don't like it hanging out in such a forward position.
moves.6. Nxf7: Crap.  I thought that my king had protected f7, but I didn't notice that the bishop was also threatening.  This could've been absolutely disastrous for me.
moves.6... Qe7: I felt like I had to save my queen if I wanted any chance to stay in this game.
moves.7. Nxh8: There goes the rook.  Now he has a great material advantage, and this game could be over fairly quickly.
moves.7... Nxe4: I decide to get whatever material that I could get at this point.  It also puts my knight into a pretty good position to attack.
moves.8. Ng6: Crap, another fork.  Really should've seen this coming...
moves.8... Qf6: Saving my queen a second time.  This time, I noticed that his king side was pretty unprotected, so I made a play for a quick mate.  If nothing else, I would at least get the knight.
moves.9. Nxf8: I guess that he didn't notice the mate looming.  Now he's got a great material advantage, but material isn't everything.
moves.9... Qxf2#: Mate.  This game is good to show the dangers of focusing too much on one or two pieces.  He was able to rack up a great advantage in material, but his defense was non-existent throughout.  I got lucky to win this one, and hopefully I won't get myself into this situation again any time soon.
